original_title: Importing EAGLE Projects Into KiCad 7, And How To Fix Them
original_content:
Migrating a PCB design from one CAD software package to another is no ones favorite task. It almost never works cleanly. Often there are missing schematic symbols, scrambled PCB footprints, and plenty of other problems. Thankfully [shabaz] shows how to import EAGLE projects into KiCad 7 and fix the most common problems one is likely to encounter in the process. Frankly, the information couldnt come at a better time.
This is very timely now that EAGLE has gone the way of the dodo. CadSoft EAGLE used to be a big shot when it came to PCB design for small organizations or individual designers, but six years after being purchased by Autodesk they are no more. KiCad 7 is a staggeringly capable open-source software package containing some fantastic features for beginner and advanced designers alike.
Of course, these kinds of tutorials tend to be perishable because software changes over time. So if youre staring down a migration from EAGLE to KiCad and could use some guidance, theres no better time than the present. [shabaz]s video showing the process is embedded below.
Thanks to [problemchild68] for the tip!
title: 「EAGLEからKiCadに変換する方法」
body: EAGLEからKiCad 7への移行方法。シンボルやフットプリントの問題を修正する方法が解説されている。絶好のタイミング。
titles: 「EAGLEプロジェクトをKiCadにインポートする際の一般的な問題とその修正方法」
「CADソフトウェアの移行におけるEAGLEからKiCadへの変換方法」
「EAGLEのサポート終了後、KiCadへの移行が重要な理由」
「EAGLEからKiCadへのプロジェクト移行に役立つチュートリアル」
